Title: Session variable assigned to data table and create object reference problem?
Answer Body:
I would suggest that you copy the datatable before placing it in session. Then, it won't be affected by any changes you make later to the original datatable.

All you have to do is declare a new DataTable variable and copy it:

private void CopyDataTable(DataTable table){
    // Create an object variable for the copy.
    DataTable copyDataTable;
    copyDataTable = table.Copy();

    // Insert code to work with the copy.
 }

Then you can put copyDataTable into session.
Abstractive Summary: To prevent changes to the original DataTable from affecting its session assignment, create a copy of the DataTable using the `Copy` method.

Title: Checking if the class attribute is empty and then removing it if true with jQuery
Answer Body:
Adding/removing classes is a core function of the jQuery library: http://docs.jquery.com/Attributes

You can see if any given collection of elements has the class in question with hasClass (http://docs.jquery.com/Attributes/hasClass#class)

And then remove a specific class with removeClass (http://docs.jquery.com/Attributes/removeClass#class)

So, if you need to remove class "abc" from a specific element do:

$("#element").removeClass("abc");

This will remove ONLY the indicated class, even if there are others in there. Adding a class works in the same way.
Abstractive Summary:
To check if an element has a specific class and remove it using jQuery, use the `hasClass` and `removeClass` methods. 

```javascript
$("#element").hasClass("class_name") ? $("#element").removeClass("class_name") : "";
```

Alternatively, use `removeClass` directly:

```javascript
$("#element").removeClass("class_name");
```

Title: NHibernate to dynamically create/alter/delete tables
Answer Body:
You could use the schema object.
You need to configure NHibernate and using the schema object call create. the two boolean values will either drop the database and recreate it or just output it to the console. VB.Net

Public Sub CreateDatabaseSchemaFromMappingFiles()
    Dim cfg As New NHibernate.Cfg.Configuration()

    cfg.Configure()

    Dim schema As New NHibernate.Tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaExport(cfg)

    schema.Create(True, False)
End Sub
Abstractive Summary:
NHibernate schema object can be used to dynamically create, alter, or delete tables. To create a database schema from mapping files, configure NHibernate and use the schema object's `Create` method with `True` for drop and create and `False` for just output to the console. 

```vbnet
Dim schema As New NHibernate.Tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaExport(cfg)
schema.Create(True, False)
```
Extractive Summary: You could use the schema object. You need to configure NHibernate and using the schema object call create. the two boolean values will either drop the database and recreate it or just output it to the console.
Ground Truth: You could use the schema object. You need to configure NHibernate and using the schema object call create. the two boolean values will either drop the database and recreate it or just output it to the console.

Title: NHibernate to dynamically create/alter/delete tables
Answer Body:
There isn't a specific API to dynamically create/alter/delete tables. Depending on what you need to do and when you want these actions to happen you have the following options:

  • Use the tag in the xml mapping files to perform whatever action you want on the database just after your schema is generated
  • Use named queries and in the mapping files to create SQL statements to run from your code. (I have never tried these with create/alter/delete table commands but its worth to try).
  • Use the Session.CreateSQLQuery() method to execute a native SQL command. (Again as the previous option I have never tried it with create/alter/delete table commands but I believe its worth to try).
Abstractive Summary: NHibernate doesn't have a direct API to dynamically create, alter, or delete tables. However, you can use XML mapping files to perform actions after schema generation, or execute native SQL commands using `Session.CreateSQLQuery()`, which can be used to create, alter, or delete tables.
Extractive Summary: There isn't a specific API to dynamically create/alter/delete tables. Use the Session. CreateSQLQuery() method to execute a native SQL command.
Ground Truth: There isn't a specific API to dynamically create/alter/delete tables. Depending on what you need to do and when you want these actions to happen you have the following options: Use the Session. CreateSQLQuery() method to execute a native SQL command.

Title: Best practice for structuring a 'large' Rails app
Answer Body:
I see the kind of problem you are facing is, trying to build an application which will have various sub domains, so account_manager a plugin can solve your problem.

also if your application is large enough to maintain than splitting them in two or three would be good idea, with restfull resources you can make your applications talk to each other and so.

while if you are thinking of having them under one database, thats quite simple in rails using the establish_connection.

I think you can split the application in three to four different applications where set of clusters will handle each applications request, so the speed will be good. also you can bundle similar kind of functionality in one app to make sure maintaining them is easy.

http://www.railslodge.com/plugins/1113-subdomain-fu
Abstractive Summary: For structuring a large Rails app, consider splitting it into multiple sub-applications or plugins, such as account_manager, to handle different sub-domains. This can be achieved using RESTful resources for inter-app communication. Alternatively, use a single database by establishing connections between applications.

Title: Objective C class problem
Answer Body:
There is no class named "Class". "Class" is the type of a pointer to a class object. Anyway, there is a classNamed: method in NSBundle, which might be what you were looking for:

Class c = [[NSBundle mainBundle] classNamed:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"%sview", [_shapeClass name]]];

If you know the class is already loaded, you can also get it like this:

Class c = NSClassFromString([NSString stringWithFormat:@"%sview", [_shapeClass name]]);
Abstractive Summary: In Objective-C, "Class" is a type of pointer, not a class itself. To get a class by name, use the `classNamed:` method of `NSBundle` or `NSClassFromString`.

Title: How to construct a new WPF form from a different thread in c#
Answer Body:
What you really need to do is construct the window/form on your main UI thread. You probably need to define a delegate that you can call from your network thread and that delegate should have a method attached that will call this.Dispatcher.BeginInvoke() -> inside which you will construct your window.

The this.Dispatcher.BeginInvoke() call is necessary to execute code on the UI thread, otherwise even with a delegate, code would be executed on the network thread.

Both the delegate and the method for creating a new chat window should probably be attached to the MainWindow...
Abstractive Summary: To construct a new WPF form from a different thread in C#, use a delegate that calls `this.Dispatcher.BeginInvoke()` to execute the window creation on the UI thread.
Extractive Summary: To construct a new WPF form from a different thread in C#, use a delegate that calls `this.Dispatcher.BeginInvoke()` to execute the window creation on the UI thread.
Ground Truth: What you really need to do is construct the window/form on your main UI thread. BeginInvoke() call is necessary to execute code on the UI thread, otherwise even with a delegate, code would be executed on the network thread. Both the delegate and the method for creating a new chat window should probably be attached to the MainWindow...

Title: VS2010 (Express) debugger trapping Ctrl+C in Console app
Answer Body:
CTRL-C is wired directly to the console window itself for the 'break' operation. Open a new console app, ping something, then immediately press CTRL-C. It aborts the ping.

You said VS Pro didn't have this behavior. I'm assuming it was just itself setting SetConsoleMode whereas VS Express doesn't. However, you can still tell the console directly to ignore CTRL-C and treat it as straight input yourself with SetConsoleMode. See this link for details:

  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms682541(VS.85).aspx

Here's an example usage in C#:

  • Windows Console Application Getting Stuck (Needs Key Press)

Just put the call with your chosen mode options at the beginning of your program and you should be good to go!

Hope this helps!

M
Abstractive Summary:
CTRL-C is handled by the console window itself in VS2010 Express. To ignore CTRL-C as a break operation, use `SetConsoleMode` to set the console mode to treat it as input. 

```csharp
SetConsoleMode(Console.OpenStandardInput(0), 0);
```
Extractive Summary: CTRL-C is wired directly to the console window itself for the 'break' operation. Windows Console Application Getting Stuck (Needs Key Press) M
Ground Truth: CTRL-C is wired directly to the console window itself for the 'break' operation. It aborts the ping. However, you can still tell the console directly to ignore CTRL-C and treat it as straight input yourself with SetConsoleMode. Just put the call with your chosen mode options at the beginning of your program and you should be good to go! Hope this helps!

Title: PHP-page and HTML-form submits look so messy, how to avoid submits to SELF?
Answer Body:
One way of managing where your code is, is for each of your forms to have a hidden field describing what the form does. Then you can check what form was submitted back and include another php file to deal with it. This kind of thing:

<?php

    switch ($_POST['action']) {

        case "remove":
                include ("remove.php");
        break;

        case "change":
                include ("change.php");
        break;

        case "edit":
                include ("update.php");
        break;

        default:
                include ("edit.php");
        break;
    }
?>

This way you ought to be able to separate your code from each other. These other php files you are including could contain just a form or just the code to process the form. Either way, it's a lot easier to maintain code this way. There are many patterns of organising code and this is just one of them.
Extractive Summary: One way of managing where your code is, is for each of your forms to have a hidden field describing what the form does. This kind of thing: This way you ought to be able to separate your code from each other.
Ground Truth: One way of managing where your code is, is for each of your forms to have a hidden field describing what the form does. Then you can check what form was submitted back and include another php file to deal with it. This way you ought to be able to separate your code from each other. Either way, it's a lot easier to maintain code this way. There are many patterns of organising code and this is just one of them.

Title: How to Send the Current Thread to Sleep
Answer Body:
Thread thred = new Thread()
{ 


    public void run() {
        while (true)
        {

         try {
                sleep(500);
                Toast toast = Toast.makeText(getApplicationContext(), "Sleep Over", 100);
             } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                // TODO Auto-generated catch block
                Toast toast = Toast.makeText(getApplicationContext(), "Sleep NOT Over", 100);
             }
        }
    }
};
thred.start();

You need to call the sleep method of the current thread Thread.sleep will call the static sleep method. You need to make sure you are overriding the run method of the thread class with your own run method and then calling thread.start not run.
Abstractive Summary: To put the current thread to sleep, use `Thread.sleep()` method in a non-static context, overriding the `run()` method of the `Thread` class.

Ground Truth: You need to call the sleep method of the current thread Thread.sleep will call the static sleep method. You need to make sure you are overriding the run method of the thread class with your own run method and then calling thread.start not run.

Title: Text align in Illustrator CS5
Answer Body:
When you create a text field, you can set its adjustment to "justify (all characters)" (you have to expand the paragraph panel for that, it's the most right adjustment). Then the text you enter is automatically distributed.

Otherwise, you can also emulate that behaviour in one of these two ways:

  1. You can either change the distance between the character manually by increasing the tracking in the character panel (I don't know its correct english name); it's the control with the "A V" and the arrow below.
  2. Or you can split the text field into one for each character and distribute that equally using the align panel.
Abstractive Summary: To align text in Illustrator CS5, use "justify (all characters)" in the paragraph panel. Alternatively, increase the tracking in the character panel or split the text into individual fields and use the align panel.
Extractive Summary: When you create a text field, you can set its adjustment to "justify (all characters)" (you have to expand the paragraph panel for that, it's the most right adjustment). Otherwise, you can also emulate that behaviour in one of these two ways: You can either change the distance between the character manually by increasing the tracking in the character panel (I don't know its correct english name); it's the control with the "A V" and the arrow below.
Ground Truth: When you create a text field, you can set its adjustment to "justify (all characters)" (you have to expand the paragraph panel for that, it's the most right adjustment). Then the text you enter is automatically distributed. Otherwise, you can also emulate that behaviour in one of these two ways: You can either change the distance between the character manually by increasing the tracking in the character panel (I don't know its correct english name); it's the control with the "A V" and the arrow below. Or you can split the text field into one for each character and distribute that equally using the align panel.

Title: What's the  best open source game to learn from?
Answer Body:
The MMORPG Ryzom was open sourced a few days ago (blog post).

While I'm not that well versed in game programming, paroneayea's comment on reddit makes me think it's worth a look:

It's hard to understate how big of a release this is. The volume of assets here, the size of the codebase.. The fact that anyone can run their own MMORPG server, or contribute back useful assets to make it into the main server!

Honestly I don't think I've been this excited about the freeing of a project since Blender was released as free and open source software nearly a decade ago.

Title: AS3: Splice two items in different places?
Answer Body:
Start removing from position with maximum index:

// it will not change firstPosition if firstPosition < secondPosition
temp.splice(secondPosition, 1); 
temp.splice(firstPosition, 1);

This will not affect positions with lower index.

Title: TortoiseSVN identifies modified file - so why does svn diff report no differences?
Answer Body:
Did the filename change in any way?

We had one case where someone copied a newer revision edited outside the working directory to the working directory. TortiseSVN marked the file has changed, but couldn't diff it. Turns out the original working copy was named "configfile.txt" and he renamed his "ConfigFile.txt" to make it more readable. When he named his file back to "configfile.txt" and copied that over, everything worked again.
Abstractive Summary: TortoiseSVN reports a file as modified, but svn diff shows no differences. The issue occurs when a file is renamed and then copied back, potentially changing its case.
Extractive Summary: Did the filename change in any way? We had one case where someone copied a newer revision edited outside the working directory to the working directory. TortiseSVN marked the file has changed, but couldn't diff it.
Ground Truth: We had one case where someone copied a newer revision edited outside the working directory to the working directory. Turns out the original working copy was named "configfile.txt" and he renamed his "ConfigFile.txt" to make it more readable. When he named his file back to "configfile.txt" and copied that over, everything worked again.

Title: Creating an unlimited SqlServer Trace
Answer Body:
According to the documentation, what you want to do is not possible:

[ @maxfilesize = ] max_file_size Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) a trace file can grow. max_file_size is bigint, with a default value of 5.

If this parameter is specified without the TRACE_FILE_ROLLOVER option, the trace stops recording to the file when the disk space used exceeds the amount specified by max_file_size.

I don't see why you can't just cycle through the files and load them into a table or your app. Shouldn't be that hard.
Abstractive Summary: SqlServer trace files have a maximum size limit of 5 MB by default, specified by the `max_file_size` parameter.

According to the documentation, what you want to do is not possible:

Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) a trace file can grow. max_file_size is bigint, with a default value of 5. Shouldn't be that hard.

According to the documentation, what you want to do is not possible:

Title: MySQL select records that sums
Answer Body:
Relying on table ID's is probably a bad idea for this, but if that is how it is really done, you could try something like this (not tested):

SELECT yourTableA.id
  FROM yourTable AS yourTableA
  JOIN yourTable AS yourTableB
 WHERE ( yourTableA.value + yourTableB.value ) = 40
   AND yourTableA.id != yourTableB.id
 ORDER BY yourTableA.id

This type of solution will only work if your expecting that you only need two rows ever to equal your target sum. Since this is most likely not the case, your best bet is probably to try and get all of the rows and do this programaticly on the returned data.

The Running Total solution posted by lc is also a good option although I generally try to avoid storing calculated data unless I absolutely have to.

Based on the updated information from this request, I have an alternate answer.

It doesn't sound so much like you care about the inventory. You care more about when the products came in.

SELECT *
  FROM product
 ORDER BY product.receivedData

Process each record as they come in, store the price for that record, and keep going for as long as you need to until you reach the number of items you need. You should end up with a list of items, the number of inventory at that level and the price at that level.
Abstractive Summary:
Two possible solutions for the MySQL query are presented. 

1. A query that joins two tables to find pairs of records with a sum of 40, but this is only suitable for cases where only two rows are needed. 
   ```sql
SELECT yourTableA.id
  FROM yourTable AS yourTableA
  JOIN yourTable AS yourTableB
 WHERE ( yourTableA.value + yourTableB.value ) = 40
   AND yourTableA.id != yourTableB.id
 ORDER BY yourTableA.id
```

2. An alternative solution that involves retrieving all records and processing them programmatically to find the desired sum.
Extractive Summary: This type of solution will only work if your expecting that you only need two rows ever to equal your target sum. Based on the updated information from this request, I have an alternate answer. It doesn't sound so much like you care about the inventory.
Ground Truth: This type of solution will only work if your expecting that you only need two rows ever to equal your target sum. Since this is most likely not the case, your best bet is probably to try and get all of the rows and do this programaticly on the returned data. Based on the updated information from this request, I have an alternate answer.

Title: Excel, OleDb, and Leading zeros
Answer Body:
I bet the data is stored in the Excel spreadsheet as text; because it wouldn't natively have leading zeroes (although the cells could be formatted to show them.) I expect OleDb is asking Excel what datatype, and Excel thinks they are strings.

Look at one of the Excel cells nad see if it has a loading zero in the data input strip at the top; or does it have a leading apostrophe or some such?

If ihis is the case (or even if it's not, but you want unformatted data), one way off the top of my head would be to copy the worksheet to another worksheet and transform the Excel column with the Val(address) function, and reformat it without leading zeroes; then read from that.
Abstractive Summary: The issue arises from Excel storing data as text with leading zeros, which OleDb interprets as strings. To get unformatted data, copy the worksheet to another sheet and apply the Val() function to remove leading zeros, then reformat the column.

If ihis is the case (or even if it's not, but you want unformatted data), one way off the top of my head would be to copy the worksheet to another worksheet and transform the Excel column with the Val(address) function, and reformat it without leading zeroes; then read from that.
Ground Truth: I bet the data is stored in the Excel spreadsheet as text; because it wouldn't natively have leading zeroes (although the cells could be formatted to show them.) I expect OleDb is asking Excel what datatype, and Excel thinks they are strings. If ihis is the case (or even if it's not, but you want unformatted data), one way off the top of my head would be to copy the worksheet to another worksheet and transform the Excel column with the Val(address) function, and reformat it without leading zeroes; then read from that.

Title: $data findAll query in CakePHP checking values from second table
Answer Body:
Supernovah -

Please clarify one thing for me: you write that you want to only have values put into $data when table1.id is found in table2.sub_id. Do you mean that table2.sub_id is a foreign key, linking to table1?

I think Beau is right -- if you have the models correctly linked, using a HABTM or belongsTo, etc., variable, the findAll should automatically pull the associated records from table2.

The final caveat is that the model associations are affected by the value of Model->recursive. If you have changed the value of the recursive property in your code, it would alter how deep the model relations are allowed to go on a given query.

HTH!

Title: Excel, OleDb, and Leading zeros
Answer Body:
Are your first 10 rows pure numeric data?

Then the driver is making a judgment call that the whole column is numeric. It chokes when it runs into data that doesn't fit. You are probably seeing this as NULL or 0.

I would try:
1) drop the IMEX - experiment without it
2) Try adding a single quote as the first character to all the data in that column.
This "forces text" in Excel. As a test just try it on the first 11 rows.
This should force the driver to see the column as text. The NULLs should disappear.

There is some way to increase the row "sample size"... but I can't remember the keyword to use in the connection string.
Abstractive Summary:
The issue arises from Excel's driver judging the column as numeric due to its first 10 rows containing numeric data. 

To resolve this, try:

1. Dropping the IMEX option from the connection string.
2. Adding a single quote as the first character to the data in the problematic column, forcing it to be treated as text.

This can be tested on the first 11 rows.
Extractive Summary:
I would try:
1) drop the IMEX - experiment without it
2) Try adding a single quote as the first character to all the data in that column. This "forces text" in Excel. As a test just try it on the first 11 rows.
Ground Truth:
Are your first 10 rows pure numeric data? Then the driver is making a judgment call that the whole column is numeric. I would try:
1) drop the IMEX - experiment without it
2) Try adding a single quote as the first character to all the data in that column. This should force the driver to see the column as text.

Title: MySQL select records that sums
Answer Body:
I don't understand your question too well. Can you try rewording it more properly? From what I interpret, here's the structure of your database:

ProductID    ArrivalDate
   1          10
   2          11
   3          11
   4          11
   5          12
   6          12

Now you are asking, "how would I know which price had each product I sold"? Which sorta confuses me, since each value in the database has no price attribute. Shouldn't your database look like this:

ProductID    ArrivalDate    Price
   1          10              100
   2          11              200
   3          11              300
   4          11              300
   5          12              400
   6          12              400

Personally, I think your idea to find out price sold is flawed. It would make more sense to add a few more fields to your database:

ProductID    ArrivalDate    Price     InStock   DateSold
   1          10              100       Yes        17
   2          11              200       Yes        17
   3          11              300       Yes        18
   4          11              300       Yes        18
   5          12              400       no        
   6          12              400       no

In changing your database, you can easily keep track of when a product arrives, the date sold, its price, maybe quantity (I can't tell if its an actual field or not).

Furthermore, you can simplify and make your life easier by separating the sql queries, or even adding some code to do some of the work for you.
Abstractive Summary:
The question seems to be about selecting records that sum a specific value, but the provided answer doesn't directly address the question. Instead, it suggests improving the database structure to include a "Price" and "DateSold" column to track sales. The recommended database structure:

```sql
ProductID    ArrivalDate    Price     InStock   DateSold
   1          10              100       Yes        17
   2          11              200       Yes        17
   3          11              300       Yes        18
   4          11              300       Yes        18
   5          12              400       no        
   6          12              400       no        
```

The answer implies that with this structure, selecting records can be simplified and made easier with separate SQL queries or additional code.

Title: WPF: Invalidate controls in ControlTemplate
Answer Body:
I suppose you might be invalidating the wrong visual. Try declaring the global variable within your object class to contain your decorator instance, override OnApplyTemplate method of decorated element and wire global variable with a decorator instance within the template by means of FindName method call. Something like: myDecorator = Template.FindName("PART_decorator", this) as MyDecoratorType (note that decorator in xaml template should have an x:Name defined as "PART_decorator" in this case).

After that you can call InvalidateVisual() against the decorator instance where appropriate in your code.
Extractive Summary: Try declaring the global variable within your object class to contain your decorator instance, override OnApplyTemplate method of decorated element and wire global variable with a decorator instance within the template by means of FindName method call. Something like: myDecorator = Template. FindName("PART_decorator", this) as MyDecoratorType (note that decorator in xaml template should have an x:Name defined as "PART_decorator" in this case).
Ground Truth: Try declaring the global variable within your object class to contain your decorator instance, override OnApplyTemplate method of decorated element and wire global variable with a decorator instance within the template by means of FindName method call. After that you can call InvalidateVisual() against the decorator instance where appropriate in your code.

Title: WCF and confirmations - do I need to send back a 'OK got it' to client?
Answer Body:
I think the question could use a little more elaboration in order to answer correctly. Primary, which type of binding are you currently using?

If you're using a binding that supports reliability, and you just want to be sure, from the client side, that server did indeed receive the message, then just turn reliability on and you're good. With this on, WCF will, under the hood automatically, have each side of the conversation say: "You got it?" "I got it. You got it?" "I got it."
Abstractive Summary: WCF confirms message receipt automatically with reliable bindings, requiring no explicit 'OK got it' response from the server.
Extractive Summary:
If you're using a binding that supports reliability, and you just want to be sure, from the client side, that server did indeed receive the message, then just turn reliability on and you're good. With this on, WCF will, under the hood automatically, have each side of the conversation say:
  "You got it?"
  "I got it. You got it?"
  "I got it."
Ground Truth: If you're using a binding that supports reliability, and you just want to be sure, from the client side, that server did indeed receive the message, then just turn reliability on and you're good.

Title: Generic Java Framework to Manage Bidirectional Associations and Inverse Updates
Answer Body:
To make sense, these calsses will be peers. I suggest a package-private mechanism (in the absense of friend) to keep consistency.

public final class A {
    private B b;
    public B getB() {
        return b;
    }
    public void setB(final B b) {
        if (b == this.b) {
            // Important!!
            return;
        }
        // Be a member of both Bs (hence check in getAs).
        if (b != null) {
            b.addA(this);
        }
        // Atomic commit to change.
        this.b = b;
        // Remove from old B.
        if (this.b != null) {
            this.b.removeA(this);
        }
    }
}

public final class B {
    private final List<A> as;
    /* pp */ void addA(A a) {
        if (a == null) {
            throw new NullPointerException();
        }
        // LinkedHashSet may be better under more demanding usage patterns.
        if (!as.contains(a)) {
            as.add(a);
        }
    }
    /* pp */ void removeA(A a) {
        if (a == null) {
            throw new NullPointerException();
        }
        as.removeA(a);
    }
    public List<A> getAs() {
        // Copy only those that really are associated with us.
        List<A> copy = new ArrayList<A>(as.size());
        for (A a : as) {
            if (a.getB() == this) {
                copy.add(a);
            }
        }
        return Collection.unmodifiableList(copy);
    }
}

(Disclaime: Not tested or even compiled.)

Mostly exception safe (may leak in exception case). Thread safety, many-many, performance, libraryisation, etc., is left as an exercise to the interested reader.
Extractive Summary: To make sense, these calsses will be peers. I suggest a package-private mechanism (in the absense of friend) to keep consistency. Mostly exception safe (may leak in exception case).
Ground Truth: To make sense, these calsses will be peers. I suggest a package-private mechanism (in the absense of friend) to keep consistency. Thread safety, many-many, performance, libraryisation, etc., is left as an exercise to the interested reader.

Title: Generic Java Framework to Manage Bidirectional Associations and Inverse Updates
Answer Body:
Unless you abstract out the setters, you are going to have to provide some sort of event notification mechanism. If your objects are JavaBeans, then you are looking at using PropertyChangeSupport and firing property change events.

If you do that (or have some other mechanism for detecting changes), then Glazed Lists provides an ObservableElementList that could easily be used to handle the association synchronization from the list end (i.e. adding A to List< A> automatically calls a.setB(b)). The other direction is easily handled using property change monitoring (or equivalent).

I realize that this isn't a generic solution, but it seems like it would be an easy foundation for one.

Note that something like this would require a special list implementation in the B class - no way short of AOP type solutions that you could handle it in the general case (i.e. using ArrayList or something like that).

I should also point out that what you are trying to achieve is something of the holy grail of data binding. There are some decent implementations for binding at the field level (stuff like getters and setters) (see JGoodies binding and JSR 295 for examples). There is also one really good implementation for list type binding (Glazed Lists, referred to above). We use both techniques in concert with each other in almost all of our applications, but have never tried to go quite as abstract as what you are asking about.

If I were designing this, I would look at something like this:

AssociationBuilder.createAssociation(A a, Connector< A> ca, B b,  Connector< B> cb, Synchronizer< A,B> sync)

Connector is an interface that allows for a single interface for various change notification types. Synchronizer is an interface that is called to make sure both objects are in sync whenever one of them is changed.

sync(ChangeInfo info, A a, B b) // make sure that b reflects current state of a and vice-versa.

ChangeInfo provides data on which member changed, and what the changes actually were. We are. If you are trying to really keep this generic, then you pretty much have to punt the implementation of this up to the framework user.

With the above in place, it would be possible to have a number of pre-defined Connectors and Synchronizers that meet different binding criteria.

Interestingly, the above method signature is pretty similar to the JSR 295 createAutoBinding() method call. Property objects are the equivalent of Connector. JSR 295 doesn't have the Synchronizer (instead, they have a binding strategy specified as an ENUM - plus JSR 295 works only with property->property binding, trying to bind a field value of one object to that object's list membership in another object is not even on the table for them).
Abstractive Summary: To manage bidirectional associations and inverse updates in Java, use a mechanism for detecting changes, such as PropertyChangeSupport. Implement a special list in the B class and use Glazed Lists' ObservableElementList to handle association synchronization. Alternatively, design an AssociationBuilder with a Connector interface for change notification and a Synchronizer interface to ensure both objects are in sync.
Extractive Summary: If you do that (or have some other mechanism for detecting changes), then Glazed Lists provides an ObservableElementList that could easily be used to handle the association synchronization from the list end (i.e. adding A to List< A> automatically calls a.setB(b)). Connector is an interface that allows for a single interface for various change notification types. Synchronizer is an interface that is called to make sure both objects are in sync whenever one of them is changed.
Ground Truth: Unless you abstract out the setters, you are going to have to provide some sort of event notification mechanism. If your objects are JavaBeans, then you are looking at using PropertyChangeSupport and firing property change events. If you do that (or have some other mechanism for detecting changes), then Glazed Lists provides an ObservableElementList that could easily be used to handle the association synchronization from the list end (i.e. adding A to List< A> automatically calls a.setB(b)). I realize that this isn't a generic solution, but it seems like it would be an easy foundation for one. We use both techniques in concert with each other in almost all of our applications, but have never tried to go quite as abstract as what you are asking about. With the above in place, it would be possible to have a number of pre-defined Connectors and Synchronizers that meet different binding criteria.

Title: Change new projects warning level in VS2008 (Express)
Answer Body:
I couldn't find any project templates or anything on my machine so I just searched in all the files for WarningLevel. I found common.js at

%\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\VC\VCWizards\1033

Searching in the file showed WarningLevel appeared in three places, lines 672, 699 and 3354. I simply changed the three lines reading

CLTool.WarningLevel = WarningLevel_3;

to

CLTool.WarningLevel = WarningLevel_4;

When I made a new project it was set at /w4. So this worked for me, won't guarantee it won't hose your machine.
Abstractive Summary:
To change the new project warning level in VS2008 Express, edit the `common.js` file at `%\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\VC\VCWizards\1033` and modify the following lines:

```csharp
CLTool.WarningLevel = WarningLevel_3;
```

to

```csharp
CLTool.WarningLevel = WarningLevel_4;
```

Answer Body:

Title: Generic Java Framework to Manage Bidirectional Associations and Inverse Updates
Answer Body:
Thanks for all suggestions. But none came close to what I was looking for, I probably formulated the question in a wrong way.

I was looking for a replacement for gemini, so for a way to handle this in an unobtrusive manner, without polluting the code with endless checks and special List implementations. This calls of course for an AOP based approach, as suggested by Kevin.

Title: Android view .setTranslationY() view cropped
Answer Body:
I had similar problem - translated view was higher than screen (wrap_content had more pixels than screen in Y dimension)and when I translated view up, bottom part was not rendered at all.

My solution: use ScrollView as slinged view, but if it reaches top of the screen, call scrollTo() instead of translateY()

private void customScroll(int y)
{
    setTranslationY(Math.max(y, 0));
    scrollTo(0,Math.max(0, -y));
}

Title: Put an image over capture image from camera
Answer Body:
You can use Apple's 'Detecting Faces in an Image' found in Core Image Programming Guide. Getting the face and face feature bounds includes left eye, right eye and mouth - x and y positions. Once you have those, it's a matter of adding a subview to the desired coordinates with any picture you like (glasses for example).

Depending on the distance between the mouth and the eyes, you can probably come up with some average distance to the top of the head if you want to add hair. Trial and error.
Abstractive Summary: To superimpose an image over a captured image from the camera, use Apple's Detecting Faces in an Image feature from the Core Image Programming Guide. Get the face and feature bounds, then add a subview at the desired coordinates with the image to be superimposed. Calculate the image position based on the distance between the mouth and eyes.
Extractive Summary: You can use Apple's 'Detecting Faces in an Image' found in Core Image Programming Guide. Getting the face and face feature bounds includes left eye, right eye and mouth - x and y positions. Trial and error.
Ground Truth: You can use Apple's 'Detecting Faces in an Image' found in Core Image Programming Guide. Once you have those, it's a matter of adding a subview to the desired coordinates with any picture you like (glasses for example). Trial and error.

Title: UITabBarController show views only if logged in
Answer Body:
Restricting which tabs are selectable, is achieved by setting a delegate of the UITabBarController (i.e. one that conforms to UITabBarControllerDelegate).

In the delegate, you should implement these two methods:

tabBarController:shouldSelectViewController:

tabBarController:didSelectViewController:

Returning valid values depending on log in status.
Abstractive Summary: To restrict which tabs are selectable in a UITabBarController based on login status, implement the `UITabBarControllerDelegate` and override the `tabBarController:shouldSelectViewController:` and `tabBarController:didSelectViewController:` methods, returning valid values depending on the login status.

Title: Multiple "If" statements in a batch file
Answer Body:
You have several small errors in your code. Note that in Batch files:

  • IF command does NOT use THEN word.
  • DO word is a part of FOR command, not IF.
  • In an IF, you must put the desired command in the same line of the IF. If you want to insert several commands enclosed in parentheses, the opening parentheses must be placed in the same line of the IF.

This is an example of a valid IF:

IF EXIST "folder_a" (
    Some Code
)

In an IF command you may only use NOT before the condition, but there is no way to combine two conditions with AND, OR, etc. However, you may nest another IF command into the first one:

IF EXIST "folder_a" IF EXIST "folder_b" IF EXIST "folder_c" (
    Some Code
)

However, you may write previous code in a slightly clearer way with the aid of a small trick:

SET AND=IF
IF EXIST "folder_a" %AND% EXIST "folder_b" %AND% EXIST "folder_c" (
    Some Code
)

NOTE: You must be aware that previous line imply three individual IF commands! This means that you can NOT use ELSE part because it belongs just to the last IF:

SET AND=IF
IF EXIST "folder_a" %AND% EXIST "folder_b" %AND% EXIST "folder_c" (
    ECHO The three folders exists
) ELSE (
    ECHO folder_a and folder_b exists, but folder_c not
)
Abstractive Summary:
Batch files use a simplified syntax for "IF" statements. Key points:

* No "THEN" keyword; the command follows on the same line.
* Use parentheses to group multiple commands.
* Only use "NOT" before the condition; combine conditions with nesting or a trick using the "SET AND=IF" command.
Extractive Summary: Note that in Batch files: IF command does NOT use THEN word. In an IF, you must put the desired command in the same line of the IF.
Ground Truth: You have several small errors in your code. This is an example of a valid IF: In an IF command you may only use NOT before the condition, but there is no way to combine two conditions with AND, OR, etc. However, you may nest another IF command into the first one: However, you may write previous code in a slightly clearer way with the aid of a small trick:

Title: Comparing two csv files matching and merging using perl
Answer Body:
Here is some Perl to get you started, just for kicks!

#!/usr/bin/perl
use strict;
use warnings;
use Data::Dumper;

my %alexa;
my ($name,$sku,$urle,$product,$data);

# Parse first file
my $line=1;
open(my $fh,"<","alexa_products.csv")|| die "ERROR: Could not open alexa_products.csv";
while (<$fh>)
{
   next if $line++==1;  # Ignore header
   chomp;       # Remove LF
   s/ //g;      # Remove spaces
   ($name,$sku,$urle,$product,$data) = split(',');  # Split line on commas
   $alexa{$name}{'sku'}=$sku;
   $alexa{$name}{'urle'}=$urle;
   $alexa{$name}{'product'}=$product;
   $alexa{$name}{'data'}=$data;
}
close($fh);

# Next line for debugging, comment out if necessary
print Dumper \%alexa;

# Now read data file 
$line=1;
open($fh,"<","Data.csv")|| die "ERROR: Could not open Data.csv";
while(<$fh>)
{
   next if $line++==1;      # Ignore header line
   chomp;           # Remove LF
   s/ //g;          # Remove spaces

   my ($name,$sku,$urle,$product,$data) = split(',');   # Split line on commas
   if(defined $alexa{$sku}){
      print "$alexa{$sku}{'sku'},$alexa{$sku}{'data'},$alexa{$sku}{'product'}\n";   # You may want different fields
   }
}
Abstractive Summary: Perl script for comparing and merging two CSV files. It reads the first file (alexa_products.csv), storing its contents in a hash, then reads the second file (Data.csv), matching records by SKU and printing the corresponding data from the first file.
Extractive Summary: Here is some Perl to get you started, just for kicks!
Ground Truth: Here is some Perl to get you started, just for kicks!

Title: Comparing two csv files matching and merging using perl
Answer Body:
You could try something along these lines:

sed "1d;s/ //g" alexa_products.csv | sort > a
sed "1d;s/ //g" data.csv | sort > b
join -t, -1 1 -2 2 a b > newfile.csv

Yes, I know it's not very good Perl ;-)

The "sed" command removes the header line (line 1), and all spaces from alexa_products.csv. Then the remainder of the file is sorted using "sort" and saved as file "a".

Likewise, file "data_products" has its header and spaces removed, gets sorted and stored in file "b".

Then "join" uses field 1 of file "a" and matches it with field "2" in file b and prints where they match.

You can use the command "man sed" or "man join" to read about the manuals about the commands - press SPACEBAR to get next page and "q" to quit reading.
Abstractive Summary:
A Perl script merges two CSV files by matching and combining corresponding rows. 

```bash
sed "1d;s/ //g" file1 | sort > a
sed "1d;s/ //g" file2 | sort > b
join -t, -1 1 -2 2 a b > newfile.csv
```

This script removes the header line and spaces, sorts each file, and then uses the `join` command to match and combine rows based on a common field.
Extractive Summary: You could try something along these lines: Likewise, file "data_products" has its header and spaces removed, gets sorted and stored in file "b". You can use the command "man sed" or "man join" to read about the manuals about the commands - press SPACEBAR to get next page and "q" to quit reading.
Ground Truth: You could try something along these lines: The "sed" command removes the header line (line 1), and all spaces from alexa_products.csv. Then the remainder of the file is sorted using "sort" and saved as file "a". Likewise, file "data_products" has its header and spaces removed, gets sorted and stored in file "b". Then "join" uses field 1 of file "a" and matches it with field "2" in file b and prints where they match.

Title: Nuxeo studio and custom UI possibility
Answer Body:
You can define your Workflow in Nuxeo Studio and deploy it on your Nuxeo server.

Then, if you build your WebApp using Angular on top of Nuxeo, it probably means you are using Automation http API.

You can then use the Automation Operations that are used to control the Workflow Service. The dedicated operations are in the "Workflow Context" and "Routing" categories.

http://explorer.nuxeo.org/nuxeo/site/distribution/current/listOperations

We are currently working on adding a dedicated workflow REST endpoint like we did for documents, users, groups, directories : this will make the Angular binding even more natural.

Tiry
Abstractive Summary: Nuxeo Studio allows defining and deploying workflows on a Nuxeo server. For a custom UI built with Angular, use the Automation API, specifically operations from the "Workflow Context" and "Routing" categories.

Title: DataTemplate in Silverlight 5 to show list data
Answer Body:
Do you see the titles at least?

If you are at least there, there's an obvious second problem:

The DataGridTextColumns are bound to collections. The ItemsSource property of the DataGrid needs to be bound to the collection in question (your dictionary pairs), while the columns get bound relative to each item in that collection.

To do that you simply use the singular forms Key and Value, which are properties of KeyValuePair<K, V>.

<sdk:DataGrid Grid.Row="2" ItemsSource="{Binding Data}">
   <sdk:DataGrid.Columns>
       <sdk:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Key}"></sdk:DataGridTextColumn>
       <sdk:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Value}"></sdk:DataGridTextColumn>
    </sdk:DataGrid.Columns>
</sdk:DataGrid>

One more thing to mention is that any changes to the dictionary after the UI initialized will not be reflected, because Dictionary<K, V>s are not observable.

If you don't even see the titles, put a

<Rectangle Width="10" Height="10" Fill="Red" />

somewhere to check whether you at least see the right amount of items.
Abstractive Summary:
DataTemplate in Silverlight 5 to show list data. To display list data, bind the DataGrid's ItemsSource to the collection, and bind the DataGridTextColumn to the Key and Value properties of KeyValuePair, like this:

```xml
<sdk:DataGrid Grid.Row="2" ItemsSource="{Binding Data}">
    <sdk:DataGrid.Columns>
        <sdk:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Key}"/>
        <sdk:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Value}"/>
    </sdk:DataGrid.Columns>
</sdk:DataGrid>
```

Note that Dictionary collections are not observable, so changes will not be reflected in the UI.
Extractive Summary: The ItemsSource property of the DataGrid needs to be bound to the collection in question (your dictionary pairs), while the columns get bound relative to each item in that collection. To do that you simply use the singular forms Key and Value, which are properties of KeyValuePair<K, V>.
Ground Truth: If you are at least there, there's an obvious second problem: The DataGridTextColumns are bound to collections. DataGrid needs to be bound to the collection in question (your dictionary pairs), while the columns get bound relative to each item in that collection. One more thing to mention is that any changes to the dictionary after the UI initialized will not be reflected, because Dictionary<K, V>s are not observable.

For multiple checkboxes, if they all have same class, then just use,

$(".className").prop("checked");

For input boxes also you can try and attach same class and check if the input is empty or not.

!$(".className").val();

The above statement should return true or false. Make manipulations based on this.

For multiple checkboxes with the same class, use `$(".className").prop("checked")`. For input boxes, use `!$(".className").val()`, which returns `true` if the input is empty and `false` otherwise.

Title: DataTemplate in Silverlight 5 to show list data
Answer Body:
You can try this :

<DataTemplate x:Key="InfoWindowDataTemplate">
   <Grid x:Name="TitleGrid">
       <Grid.RowDefinitions>
         <RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
         <RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
         <RowDefinition Height="*"/>
       </Grid.RowDefinitions>
         <TextBlock x:Name="TxtTitle" Text="{Binding Path = Title}" Width="Auto" Height="Auto" FontWeight="Bold" Grid.Row="0"/>
         <TextBlock x:Name="TxtLineDivider" Text ="-----------------------------" Width="Auto" Height="Auto" Grid.Row="1"/>
         <sdk:DataGrid Grid.Row="2" ItemsSource="{Binding Path = Data}">
             <sdk:DataGrid.Columns>
               <sdk:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Keys}"></sdk:DataGridTextColumn>
               <sdk:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Values}"></sdk:DataGridTextColumn>
             </sdk:DataGrid.Columns>
         </sdk:DataGrid>
        </Grid>
</DataTemplate>

What I did is :

  • Removed 2 StackPanels. In most case when your StackPanel or any other container control contains only single control, that means you don't need the container.
  • Removed ItemsControl. Your ItemsControl contains a DataGrid when the DataGrid it self is enough to display multi row -and multi column- data. You need to choose either to use ItemsControl or DataGrid in this part.

Note that until this point I only provide some correction to your DataTemplate construction. But as you said in comment, you didn't see a repetitive structure when trying to debug, then the problem possibly resides in the place where you use the DataTemplate. You should use DataTemplate as Item Template of a control that can show multiple items such as ListBox or the same to be able to see that repetitive structure.
Abstractive Summary:
A simplified DataTemplate for displaying list data in Silverlight 5, removing unnecessary controls and containers. 

The updated template uses a Grid with two DataGridTextColumns, one for Keys and one for Values, bound to the Data property.
Extractive Summary: You can try this : DataGrid when the DataGrid
Ground Truth: In most case when your StackPanel or any other container control contains only single control, that means you don't need the container. You need to choose either to use ItemsControl or DataGrid in this part. But as you said in comment, you didn't see a repetitive structure when trying to debug, then the problem possibly resides in the place where you use the DataTemplate. You should use DataTemplate as Item Template of a control that can show multiple items such as ListBox or the same to be able to see that repetitive structure.

Title: Creating symbolic links in AIX 6.1 server
Answer Body:
You can move it to the side: 

mv <orig-path> <new-path>

i.e. 

mv /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a-orig

then if you want to go back like it was, move it back: 

mv /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a-orig /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a.

If or when you want to go back, you would need to remove what you created at /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a (such as the symlink you are trying to create).
Abstractive Summary:
To create a symbolic link in AIX 6.1, use the `mv` command to rename the original file to a temporary name, then create the symbolic link using the original name. 

```bash
mv <orig-path> <new-path>
mv /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a-orig
mv /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a-orig /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a
```
Extractive Summary: You can move it to the side: i.e. then if you want to go back like it was, move it back:
Ground Truth: You can move it to the side: then if you want to go back like it was, move it back: If or when you want to go back, you would need to remove what you created at /opt/freeware/lib/libssl.a (such as the symlink you are trying to create).

Title: How to Change Foreground Color of Image in View
Answer Body:
It might be simpler to create a copy of the image and edit it in Photoshop, GIMP or Paint.NET. These apps have tools for swapping pixel colors.

Then you can either swap out the image URI to switch the image. Or you can overlay the foreground color image overtop of the main image, setting its Visibility=Collapsed. Then set Visibility=Visible as needed.

If you are using the standard black/white app icons, they have versions that are white-on-black and black-on-white.
Abstractive Summary: To change the foreground color of an image in a view, create a copy of the image and edit it using image editing software like Photoshop, GIMP, or Paint.NET to swap pixel colors. Alternatively, use the image URI or overlay the foreground color image with Visibility set to Collapsed, then toggle Visibility as needed.
Extractive Summary: These apps have tools for swapping pixel colors. Then you can either swap out the image URI to switch the image. Then set Visibility=Visible as needed.
Ground Truth: It might be simpler to create a copy of the image and edit it in Photoshop, GIMP or Paint. These apps have tools for swapping pixel colors. Or you can overlay the foreground color image overtop of the main image, setting its Visibility=Collapsed. If you are using the standard black/white app icons, they have versions that are white-on-black and black-on-white.

Title: results ordering by the query string
Answer Body: The database (MongoDB) can not sort by arbitrary value, so you will have to do this in your application. This is a very specific type of sorting, and I doubt you would fine any database that can do thisexcept for perhaps SQLite where you can call out into your (scripting) language to set your sorting comparison function.
Abstractive Summary: MongoDB cannot sort by arbitrary values, requiring the application to handle sorting instead, except for SQLite which can utilize scripting language for custom sorting comparisons.
Extractive Summary: The database (MongoDB) can not sort by arbitrary value, so you will have to do this in your application. This is a very specific type of sorting, and I doubt you would fine any database that can do thisexcept for perhaps SQLite where you can call out into your (scripting) language to set your sorting comparison function.
Ground Truth: The database (MongoDB) can not sort by arbitrary value, so you will have to do this in your application. This is a very specific type of sorting, and I doubt you would fine any database that can do thisexcept for perhaps SQLite where you can call out into your (scripting) language to set your sorting comparison function.

Title: Querying user_meta table to look up email in the wp_users table
Answer Body:
You should update your code:

<?php
global $wpdb;
$userInfo = $wpdb->get_row  ( $wpdb->prepare ("
    SELECT user_id, user_email
    FROM $wpdb->usermeta um
    INNER JOIN $wpdb->users u ON (u.ID=um.user_id)
    WHERE meta_key = %s", //OR meta_value !!
    $_POST["submitted_value"]
));


echo 'Car Owner Email is' . $userInfo->user_email. '!';
echo "test" . $_POST["submitted_value"] ."!";

?>

But you can do it easily following the WP codex: http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_users/

$users = get_users(array('meta_key' => $_POST["submitted_value"]));

In this case you will get all possible users and you may need to run a loop.
Abstractive Summary:
WP query to retrieve user email from the `wp_users` table based on a meta key value from the `wp_usermeta` table can be simplified using the `get_users` function from the WP Codex.

```php
get_users(array('meta_key' => $_POST["submitted_value"]));
```

This function returns all users with the specified meta key, which can then be looped through to retrieve the desired user email.
Extractive Summary: But you can do it easily following the WP codex: http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_users/ In this case you will get all possible users and you may need to run a loop.
Ground Truth: You should update your code: But you can do it easily following the WP codex: http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_users/

Title: Querying user_meta table to look up email in the wp_users table
Answer Body:
global $wpdb;
$query1 = "SELECT user_id FROM wp_usermeta WHERE meta_key = 'your_meta_key_name' AND meta_value = '$_POST["submitted_value"]'";
$userid = $wpdb->get_var($query1);

$query = "SELECT user_email FROM wp_users WHERE ID = '$userid'";
$useremail = $wpdb->get_var($query);
  1. Table name is wp_usermeta and not wp_user_meta

  2. In WHERE Clause, you need to give a meta key with which the value has to be mapped. Ex: WHERE meta_key = 'nickname' and meta_value = 'pranita'. Replace 'your_meta_key_name' with proper key with which you are matching your form value.

  3. If you don't understand fields, check wp_usermeta table in phpmyadmin.

Hope this helps. All The Best
Abstractive Summary:
wp_usermeta table can be queried to look up a user's email by first matching a specific meta key and value, then retrieving the user's ID, and finally using that ID to retrieve the email from the wp_users table. 

`$query1 = "SELECT user_id FROM wp_usermeta WHERE meta_key = 'your_meta_key_name' AND meta_value = '$_POST["submitted_value"]'";`
`$wpdb->get_var($query1);`
`$wpdb->get_var("SELECT user_email FROM wp_users WHERE ID = '$userid'");`
Extractive Summary: In WHERE Clause, you need to give a meta key with which the value has to be mapped. Replace 'your_meta_key_name' with proper key with which you are matching your form value. All The Best
Ground Truth: Table name is wp_usermeta and not wp_user_meta In WHERE Clause, you need to give a meta key with which the value has to be mapped. Hope this helps.

Title: FileNotFoundException trying to send JSON to .NET webservice using HttpURLConnection
Answer Body:
There were a few mistakes with what I was doing,firstly I was passing the wrong parameter Vaue instead of Value to the service.

   JSONObject obj=new JSONObject();
    try {
        String value_key="Value";
        obj.put(value_key, value);
        Log.d(TAG,obj.toString());
    } catch (JSONException e) {
        Log.e(TAG, "Create JSONObjerct throws an error");
    }

Secondly,I was trying to parse a response when no response was being sent.So, I replace the code to get the InputStream with the following code:

 int response=urlConnection.getResponseCode();

The entire code is here:

java.net.URL url=null;
    try {
        url = new java.net.URL(SOAP_ACTION);
    } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
        Log.e(TAG, "Bad URL",e);
    }
    JSONObject obj=new JSONObject();
    try {
        String value_key="Value";
        obj.put(value_key, value);
        Log.d(TAG,obj.toString());
    } catch (JSONException e) {
        Log.e(TAG, "Create JSONObjerct throws an error");
    }
    HttpURLConnection urlConnection = null;
    try {
        urlConnection = (HttpURLConnection)url.openConnection();
    } catch (IOException e1) {
        Log.e(TAG,"Error opening connection",e1);
    }
    urlConnection.setDoOutput(true);
    try {
        urlConnection.setRequestMethod("POST");
        urlConnection.setRequestProperty("Accept", "*/*");
        //urlConnection.addRequestProperty("Accept-Encoding", "gzip deflate sdch");
        urlConnection.setRequestProperty("Content-Type","application/json");
    } catch (ProtocolException e) {
        Log.e(TAG,"Error setting header",e);
    }
    try {
        urlConnection.connect();
        DataOutputStream dos=new DataOutputStream(urlConnection.getOutputStream());
        dos.write(obj.toString().getBytes());
        int response=urlConnection.getResponseCode();
        Log.d(TAG, "Response code: "+response);
        urlConnection.disconnect();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        Log.e(TAG,"Error peforming read-write operations",e);
    }

And finally I used this to send the data to the web-service as binary data:

  DataOutputStream dos=new DataOutputStream(urlConnection.getOutputStream());
    dos.write(obj.toString().getBytes());
Abstractive Summary: The problem was a `FileNotFoundException` when sending JSON to a .NET webservice using `HttpURLConnection`. The issue was caused by passing the wrong parameter name (`Vaue` instead of `Value`) and trying to parse a response when none was being sent. The corrected code includes checking the response code with `int response=urlConnection.getResponseCode();`.
Extractive Summary: There were a few mistakes with what I was doing,firstly I was passing the wrong parameter Vaue instead of Value to the service. Secondly,I was trying to parse a response when no response was being sent.
Ground Truth: There were a few mistakes with what I was doing,firstly I was passing the wrong parameter Vaue instead of Value to the service. Secondly,I was trying to parse a response when no response was being sent. And finally I used this to send the data to the web-service as binary data:

Title: javascript: open window and print
Answer Body:
You should provide the full url when possible, else it tries to use the relative url.

var printWindow = window.open('', '', 'width=1000,height=700'); would open a blank url

var printWindow = window.open('print.aspx', '', 'width=1000,height=700'); opens page print.aspx relative to current url. So if current url is www.google.com, it opens www.google.com/print.aspx, which would be 404 page not found.

Be careful of some sites which will redirect you, which can confuse you. For example if you run this on current stackoverflow page it would open this page itself because http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18633800/xxxxxx/print.aspx would redirect to http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18633800/xxxxxx

Also the jquery wont work because you cannot copy content from one window to another through javascript. Both are separate and cannot communicate.
Abstractive Summary: When opening a new window in JavaScript, use `window.open()` with the full URL to avoid issues with relative URLs and redirects. The function signature is `var printWindow = window.open('full_url', '', 'width=height');`.
Extractive Summary: You should provide the full url when possible, else it tries to use the relative url. var printWindow = window.open('', '', 'width=1000,height=700'); would open a blank url var printWindow = window.open('print.aspx', '', 'width=1000,height=700'); opens page print.aspx relative to current url. Be careful of some sites which will redirect you, which can confuse you.
Ground Truth: You should provide the full url when possible, else it tries to use the relative url. var printWindow = window.open('', '', 'width=1000,height=700'); would open a blank url var printWindow = window.open('print.aspx', '', 'width=1000,height=700'); opens page print.aspx relative to current url. So if current url is www.google.com, it opens www.google.com/print.aspx, which would be 404 page not found. For example if you run this on current stackoverflow page it would open this page itself because http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18633800/xxxxxx/print.aspx would redirect to http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18633800/xxxxxx Also the jquery wont work because you cannot copy content from one window to another through javascript.

Title: How to send custom message to one friend using iOS facebook-graph-api?
Answer Body:
The way to do this is to set up a simple XMPP server on your server and send it using their XMPP login which you can get with the following code snippet.

if (![FBSession.activeSession.permissions containsObject:@"xmpp_login"]){
        [[FBSession activeSession] requestNewReadPermissions:@[@"xmpp_login"] completionHandler:^(FBSession * session, NSError * error){
            if (!error){
                [self functionThatCommunicatesWithServerAndSendsXMPPLoginInformation];
            } else {
                // handle error
            }
        }];
    }

There are some nice frameworks that make XMPP really easy to implement on a simple level, such as SleekXMPP for python/django.

It's definitely a little work to do this, but probably much more effective. Just don't spam.

For more guides (although I think a little outdated):

Facebook chat framework for iphone sdk

The way to do this is to set up a simple XMPP server on your server and send it using their XMPP login which you can get with the following code snippet. Just don't spam. For more guides (although I think a little outdated):
Facebook chat framework for iphone sdk

Title: Null pointer exception when ran outside netbeans
Answer Body:
Your code refers to a src folder which ought to be not present anymore, if your code is deployed. The right way to access resources would be

// no src/ in the resource name
InputStream is=getClass().getResourceAsStream("/frogger/highScores.DAT");
fileStream = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(file));

Your IDE typically copies resources from src to the location of the generated class files. But if you deploy your application you have to care that the file is packaged with it.

If frogger matches the package name of your class you can do a relative lookup

InputStream is=getClass().getResourceAsStream("highScores.DAT");

Note that the NullPointerException comes naturally as you are catching the IOException and then proceeding as nothing has happened with an uninitialized Reader. You should rather ensure the code dealing with the resource is not executed when the allocation fails.

But for things like highscores you should consider the Preferences API instead which gives you a persistent storage independent from your applications location.
Abstractive Summary:
NullPointerException when running outside NetBeans is due to incorrect resource access. 

To fix, use absolute path `getClass().getResourceAsStream("/frogger/highScores.DAT")` or relative path `getClass().getResourceAsStream("highScores.DAT")` if the file is in the same package as the class.
Extractive Summary: The right way to access resources would be Your IDE typically copies resources from src to the location of the generated class files. If frogger matches the package name of your class you can do a relative lookup
Ground Truth: Your code refers to a src folder which ought to be not present anymore, if your code is deployed. But if you deploy your application you have to care that the file is packaged with it. Note that the NullPointerException comes naturally as you are catching the IOException and then proceeding as nothing has happened with an uninitialized Reader. You should rather ensure the code dealing with the resource is not executed when the allocation fails. But for things like highscores you should consider the Preferences API instead which gives you a persistent storage independent from your applications location.

Title: DragDropEffect.Copy Resets itself to None
Answer Body:
What is the (DragEventArgs).AllowedEffects property value? You can only set the (DragEventArgs).Effects property to one of the values specified by the (DragEventArgs).AllowedEffects property. If DragDropEffects.Copy is not an option found in the (DragEventArgs).AllowedEffects property enumeration, then you will not be able to use that function.

You can set that option when you create your data object and call DoDragDrop:

DragDrop.DoDragDrop(item, dragData, DragDropEffects.All);

UPDATE >>>

As I said, normally, you set the allowable DragDropEffects enumeration when you call DoDragDrop... after seeing that you have called the SurfaceDragCursor.BeginDragDrop method, I looked online at the SurfaceDragDrop.BeginDragDrop Method page at MSDN and found this:

public static SurfaceDragCursor BeginDragDrop (
    FrameworkElement dragSource,
    FrameworkElement draggedElement,
    FrameworkElement cursorVisual,
    Object data,
    IEnumerable<InputDevice> inputDevices,
    DragDropEffects allowedEffects
)

I'm guessing that the last parameter here is where you set the DragDropEffects allowable effect enumeration.
Abstractive Summary: DragDropEffect.Copy resets to None if it's not specified in the AllowedEffects property. To set Copy as an allowed effect, pass DragDropEffects.All to DoDragDrop.
Extractive Summary: You can only set the (DragEventArgs).Effects property to one of the values specified by the (DragEventArgs).AllowedEffects property. If DragDropEffects. UPDATE >>> As I said, normally, you set the allowable DragDropEffects enumeration when you call DoDragDrop...
Ground Truth: What is the (DragEventArgs).AllowedEffects property value? You can only set the (DragEventArgs).Effects property to one of the values specified by the (DragEventArgs).AllowedEffects property. Copy is not an option found in the (DragEventArgs).AllowedEffects property enumeration, then you will not be able to use that function. UPDATE >>> As I said, normally, you set the allowable DragDropEffects enumeration when you call DoDragDrop... I'm guessing that the last parameter here is where you set the DragDropEffects allowable effect enumeration.

Title: Completely wiping dotnetnuke cache
Answer Body:
If you've used the "Tools, Clear Cache and Reset Application" option, you likely are running into some other issue, not caching related. Or a Browser Cache issue perhaps.

I would start by confirming that the data is actually there (always best to just double check, even if you think it is).

Make sure your module is connecting to the proper table (maybe you're using a objectQualifier in development but not in production)
Abstractive Summary: When the "Clear Cache and Reset Application" option in dotnetnuke doesn't work, check if the issue is due to a browser cache or another problem. Confirm the data exists and ensure the module is connected to the correct table, possibly checking for differences in objectQualifiers between development and production environments.
Extractive Summary: Or a Browser Cache issue perhaps. I would start by confirming that the data is actually there (always best to just double check, even if you think it is). Make sure your module is connecting to the proper table (maybe you're using a objectQualifier in development but not in production)
Ground Truth: If you've used the "Tools, Clear Cache and Reset Application" option, you likely are running into some other issue, not caching related. Title: Codeigniter Form Helper - How to add additional parameters to "select" control?
Answer Body:
In case it helps anyone, I found a work-around using JQuery.

I made a javascript function that applied the data-image attribute to each option field once the page was ready, then called the msDropdown function afterwards.

function PiccifyShowDropdown(){

var Diagrams = new Array(
"/assets/images/icons/SixtyToHundredPercent.png",
"/assets/images/icons/LessThanThirtyPercent.png",
"/assets/images/icons/ThirtyToSixtyPercent.png",
"/assets/images/icons/SixtyToHundredPercent.png"
);

$("#Show > option").each(

    function()  {
        $(this).attr("data-image",Diagrams[this.index]);
                }

    );

$("#Show").msDropdown({visibleRows:2}); 


}

This seems to have worked, so now I just need someone to solve the same problem as this guy...

Title: Completely wiping dotnetnuke cache
Answer Body:
Restarting the application should kill the cache, BUT, make sure that you don't have EnableCachePersistence set to True in the appSettings section of your web.config.

Otherwise, all of Chris Hammond's recommendations are the best next steps.

Title: PHP DateTime microseconds always returns 0
Answer Body:
PHP documentation clearly says "Note that date() will always generate 000000 since it takes an integer parameter...". If you want a quick replacement for date() function use below function:

function date_with_micro($format, $timestamp = null) {
    if (is_null($timestamp) || $timestamp === false) {
        $timestamp = microtime(true);
    }
    $timestamp_int = (int) floor($timestamp);
    $microseconds = (int) round(($timestamp - floor($timestamp)) * 1000000.0, 0);
    $format_with_micro = str_replace("u", $microseconds, $format);
    return date($format_with_micro, $timestamp_int);
}

(available as gist here: date_with_micro.php)
Abstractive Summary: A function `date_with_micro` replaces PHP's `date()` function, which always returns microseconds as 0, by manually extracting microseconds from the current timestamp. The function takes a format string and an optional timestamp, and returns the formatted date with microseconds.
Extractive Summary: If you want a quick replacement for date() function use below function: (available as gist here: date_with_micro.php)
Ground Truth: PHP documentation clearly says "Note that date() will always generate 000000 since it takes an integer parameter...". If you want a quick replacement for date() function use below function: (available as gist here: date_with_micro.php)

Title: Error creating bean with name 'sessionFactory' Unable to instantiate default tuplizer [org.hibernate.tuple.entity.PojoEntityTuplizer]
Answer Body:
I had the same issue about an hour ago and solved it using the following tips mentioned in the link

http://jonathan.lalou.free.fr/?p=2026

The problem is because of asm jar incompatibility with hibernate version. So as soon as you change it the problem will be solved.

make sure to add the property tags out of the dependencies. Also clean your project to remove everything from target folder. Then clean install your maven to retrieve all compatible jars.
Abstractive Summary: The issue is caused by an incompatibility between the ASM JAR and Hibernate version. To resolve it, add the ASM JAR outside the dependencies, clean the project, and perform a Maven clean install to retrieve compatible JARS.
Extractive Summary: The problem is because of asm jar incompatibility with hibernate version. So as soon as you change it the problem will be solved. Then clean install your maven to retrieve all compatible jars.
Ground Truth: The problem is because of asm jar incompatibility with hibernate version. So as soon as you change it the problem will be solved. Then clean install your maven to retrieve all compatible jars.

Title: iOS7 compatibility with App on iPad
Answer Body:

Title: Java Sorting alphabet and get position number
Answer Body:
Using Ascii values

public class Ssort 
{
    public static void main(String[] args) 
    {
        Scanner s=new Scanner(System.in);
        String s1=s.nextLine();
        String s2=s1.toLowerCase();
        char []a=s2.toCharArray();
        int h,g = 0,l=0;
        int b=(int)a[0];
        System.out.println();
        for(int k=0;k<a.length;k++)
        {
            for(h=1+k;h<a.length;h++)
            {
                if(b>(int)a[h])
                {   
                    b=a[h];
                    char temp=a[h];
                    a[h]=a[k];
                    a[k]=temp;
                }

            }
        if(l<a.length-1)
        {
                b=a[++l];
        }
        }

        for(int j=0;j<a.length;j++)
        {
            System.out.print(a[j]);
        }
    }

}

using alphabet to sort

public class Hi1 {


    public static void main(String[] args)
    {
        String s1,s3;
        java.lang.String s2;
        int i,j;
        Scanner s=new Scanner(System.in);
        s1=s.nextLine();
        s2="abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";
        s3=s1.toLowerCase();
        char [] c=s3.toCharArray();
        char [] c1=s2.toCharArray();
        for(i=0;i<c1.length;i++)
        {
            for(j=0;j<c.length;j++)
            {
                if(c1[i]==c[j])
                {
                    System.out.print(c[j]);
                }
                else
                {
                    continue;
                }
            }
        }
        //System.out.println(c[0]);
    }

}
Abstractive Summary:
Two Java solutions to sort strings alphabetically and find the position number. 

1. Using ASCII values, the first solution iterates through the array, swapping elements if a larger character is found, effectively sorting the array in-place.
2. The second solution uses a predefined alphabet string to print characters in the correct order, effectively sorting the input string alphabetically.
Extractive Summary: Using Ascii values using alphabet to sort
Ground Truth: Using Ascii values using alphabet to sort

Title: How to append several lines when iterating through List?
Answer Body:
change

 if (!lines.ElementAt(name_index + 1).StartsWith("SHORT_NAME")) //checking if   
                //the next line does not start with SHORT_NAME (then it is continuation of NAME)
                {                       
                    new_line = line + " " + lines.ElementAt(name_index + 1);//appending the next
                                                                            //line
                    full_lines.Add(new_line); //adding into new list
                }                   
                else
                {                        
                    full_lines.Add(line);
                }

to 

     new_line = line;
     name_index++;
     while (!lines.ElementAt(name_index).StartsWith("SHORT_NAME"))                       
     {                       
     new_line = new_line + " " + lines.ElementAt(name_index);//appending the next line
     name_index++;
     }  

     full_lines.Add(new_line);
Ground Truth: change
